s2.ptxt: Apply a light coat of Prussian blue to the valve face.
Lightly press the valve face against the valve seat.
Check the valve face and valve seat according to the following procedures.

s3.ptxt: If blue appears 360° around the valve face, the valve face is concentric. If not, replace the valve.
If blue appears 360° around the valve seat, the guide and valve face are concentric. If not, resurface the valve seat.
Check that the valve seat contact is in the middle of the valve face with the width between 1.0 to 1.4 mm (0.039 to 0.055 in.).

atten3.ptxt: Keep the lip free from foreign matter.

s2.ptxt: If the seating is too high on the valve face, use 30° and 45° cutters to correct the seat.
If the seating is too low on the valve face, use 60° and 45° cutters to correct the seat.
Hand-lap the valve and valve seat with an abrasive compound.
Apply a light coat of Prussian blue to the valve face.
Lightly press the valve face against the valve seat.
Check the valve face and valve seat according to the following procedures.

s3.ptxt: If blue appears 360° around the valve face, the valve face is concentric. If not, replace the valve.
If blue appears 360° around the valve seat, the guide and valve face are concentric. If not, resurface the valve seat.

If the seating is too low on the valve face, use 60° and 45° cutters to correct the seat.

item.ptxt: Bore all 4 cylinders for the O/S piston outside diameter.
Replace all the piston rings with ones to match the O/S pistons.

s2.ptxt: Using a micrometer, measure the piston diameter at right angles to the piston center line at the indicated distance from the piston end.
Calculate how much each cylinder needs to be rebored:

spec.title: Size to be rebored = P + C - H

specitem.ptxt: C = Piston clearance: 0.040 to 0.047 mm (0.0016 to 0.0019 in.)
H = Allowance for honing: 0.02 mm (0.0008 in.) or less

s2.ptxt: Bore and hone the cylinders to the calculated dimensions.

atten3.ptxt: Excess honing will destroy the finished roundness.
